channel.title: RuneScape New website and Hiscores, 'a members-only feature'
channel.description:
Well as many of you know, Jagex is making the new website, http://services.runescape.com/m=news/coming-next-week-new-website As I read the 'in other news', I noticed that the hiscores which is available for everyone, is now only going to be a members only feature.
In Other News... - Along with the release of the new website, we will be making hi-scores a members-only feature. This is for a number of reasons, but the main one is to keep them fresh. We want the hiscores to feature players who will compete with each other, tooth and nail, for hiscore glory. There are many dormant accounts within the hiscores that have not played for a very long time, and this will give new arrivals in Gielinor a shot at hiscore fame alongside the grizzled veterans on equal terms for all. We want the hiscores to reflect the full range of content that RuneScape has to offer, and hope that they will be a big draw to the full, members’ game for those interested in high-level RuneScape competition on a level playing field.
Does anyone find this stupid or unfair? o.o

item.title: RuneScape New website and Hiscores, 'a members-only feature'
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:32, topic:421725”][quote author=Kidpaparoach link=topic=524382.msg3818630#msg3818630 date=1321571057]
he could crash worlds;o?
[/quote]

Due to the swarms of people trying to log on to his world.[/quote]
Ah thanks for telling me.
Dayum, this happens to me all the times cause i do shrimp drop parties ;o.

Read full topic

item.title: RuneScape New website and Hiscores, 'a members-only feature'
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

reyx7:

He’s also a pmod as of 2009. I remember back in the day, he had the ultimate power of population swaying. In 06, when private was always on, most people had zezima added. He could litterly tap friends public, then turn it back to private, just long.enough to see his world #. He could make everyone in w1-w10 fight for a spot in w85 or some empty place.

I think he was the only person (single person) ever to crash a world. Remember those days. I remember when he was level 30… oh the days.

Read full topic

[/quote]

item.title: RuneScape New website and Hiscores, 'a members-only feature'
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

There should be a grace period for members who lose membership. For instance if I was a member, and didn’t renew my membership status, I should maintain my position on the highscores for up to 3 months. If by that time I haven’t renewed my membership then they can remove me from the highscores.

Read full topic
item.source: RuneScape New website and Hiscores, 'a members-only feature'

item.title: RuneScape New website and Hiscores, 'a members-only feature'
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Eh, that idea seems a bit strange. You may as well just raise the minimum level you need to be listen in the high scores? But if those people that lose member still play (as f2p or w/e) they wouldn’t be removed based on activity

Or a combination of both

Read full topic
item.source: RuneScape New website and Hiscores, 'a members-only feature'

item.title: RuneScape New website and Hiscores, 'a members-only feature'
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Hmm. Rather than removing inactive players from the high scores, I think they should just let people who have a certain amount of experience remain on the high score regardless of membership status. I’m mainly thinking about the many people with 200,000,000 exp who will lose their spot because they aren’t members anymore. Perhaps that’s the ploy Jagex is ultimately trying to play here. Perhaps they simply want to open up the top ranks to people who will remain active, to keep a constantly competitive high scores page.

Either way, I must say their solution is definitely members-oriented and, thereby, money-oriented.

Read full topic
item.source: RuneScape New website and Hiscores, 'a members-only feature'

item.title: RuneScape New website and Hiscores, 'a members-only feature'
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Rodgerwilco, post:15, topic:421725”]Wtf is the point of this… they state …

We want the hiscores to feature players who will compete with each other, tooth and nail, for hiscore glory

There is no glory when nobody can see it!

The hiscores have been useless since like 2007…
01-04 had the best competition.[/quote]They didn’t say ‘see’ it, they said ‘be in it’. Same concept though really.

Read full topic
item.source: RuneScape New website and Hiscores, 'a members-only feature'

item.title: RuneScape New website and Hiscores, 'a members-only feature'
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

I think the reasoning behind it is just.

Davidi2:

I like the concept - removing inactive players from the highscores, but I don’t like the method. In fact, being high ranked and free to play would be more of an accomplishment then being a member of the same rank. They should have had it be X months without logging in (or gaining xp, whatever) or something. I agree with Taharok though, they certainly aren’t being very consistent.

Good point.

I think thought inactive should be removed from the main highscores and moved into a archive version of the high scores unless they have been logged into?

Read full topic

item.title: RuneScape New website and Hiscores, 'a members-only feature'
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“the elve age, post:11, topic:421725”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=524382.msg3816301#msg3816301 date=1321382095]
An update with player-driven content is a bit unnerving for me. I also feel sorry for rs wikia, as its purpose will dwindle after the website update…
[/quote]I disagree. Its just another competition. RS Wikia ALREADY has all of the info, and the player base. The members only high scores is stupid, its not high scores, its “high member scores”[/quote]

RS Wikia’s user base is significantly smaller than what the official RS wiki will have, not to mention I would expect a large portion of the RS wikia population to feel the obligation to push their content onto the official RS wiki, to try and “preserve” it. But it will ultimately decide upon how the official RS wiki will work. Jagex will probably have some means of censoring it, and RS wikia will always remain uncensored and undescriminated.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“modzilla, post:9, topic:421725”]yea seriously… free to play is a demo and its only like $6 a month which you can actually buy with rsgp on sythe for like 8m…
Not to mention you could easily make 10m in 2 days somewhere like green drags…

Im not picking sides but if i were id tend to the fact the hiscore member only would bring more free to plays in than not. Its not like members are gunna quit because of it and if free to play quit then who cares? they dont make money off them.
Jagex only wants money…[/quote]
wat @ first blur
